intro: Hieracium eutonophyton, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, and it often grows in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium eutonophyton is an erect perennial that can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. It has lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
